newsitem.title: USA: MetLife, New England Mutual complete merger.
newsitem.headline: MetLife, New England Mutual complete merger.

text.p: Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. and New England Mutual Life Insurance Co. said Tuesday they have completed their merger, creating a company with combined assets under management of $275 billion.
It is the largest merger ever in the life insurance industry, MetLife said.
Under the terms of the merger, policyholders of The New England are now policyholders of MetLife and their policies are backed by the combined assets of both companies.
Most operations of New England Mutual Life Insurance Co. have been transferred to New England Variable Life Insurance Co., formerly its subsidiary, and renamed New England Life Insurance Co.
New England Life Insurance Co. operates as a wholly-owned subsidiary of MetLife and will retain The New England's management, national distribution system, work force and Boston-based headquarters.
MetLife and The New England began merger discussions at the end of 1994 and signed a definitive merger agreement in August 1995.
Policyholders from both companies voted in favour of the merger in proxies counted in July 1996.
The Massachusetts and New York insurance departments as well as other state regulators approved the merger in August 1996.

"In an increasingly competitive financial world, this merger brings together the special talents of two great companies to produce a potent force that will lead to greater growth for each company," MetLife Chairman Harry Kamen said in a statement.
